titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Fiametta Olschki Papers relating to Leo S. Olschki (Firm) and Olschki family members, 1904-1994
titlepage.publisher:
Department of Special Collections and University Archives
Stanford University Libraries
Stanford, California

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Olschki, Fiammetta. Papers relating to Leo S. Olschki (Firm) and Olschki family members,

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

did.abstract: Includes personal family correspondence between the Wittkowers and their son, and between the Olschkis and their children. The papers of the firm include individual files of correspondence with major scholars and collectors. In addition, there is a history of the firm written by Fiammetta Olschki Witt and information about her catalogue raisonné of European travel books, 1990. Included in the papers of the firm is a file on the Serristori archive (1452-195?) with descriptions and the 1982 valuation; a political oddment file with a German anti-semitic leaflet, 1933, and student protest material from the 1960s and early 70s; and three files about the Florence flood, documenting the losses suffered by the firm, 1966-67.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Gift of Fiammetta Olschki Witt, 1995 and 1998.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: Fiametta Olschki Papers relating to Leo S. Olschki (Firm) and Olschki family members. M0739. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Leo S. Olschki was founder in 1886 of the prestigious publishing house of the same name. Fiammetta Witt née Olschki married Mario Max Witt (earlier Wittkower). She is the granddaughter of Leo Samuel Olschki, and niece of Leonardo Olschki and Cesare Olschki. Mario Witt's parents were Rudolf and Margot Wittkower.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes personal family correspondence between the Wittkowers and their son, and between the Olschkis and their children. The papers of the firm include individual files of correspondence with major scholars and collectors. In addition, there is a history of the firm written by Fiammetta Olschki Witt and information about her catalogue raisonné of European travel books, 1990. Included in the papers of the firm is a file on the Serristori archive (1452-195?) with descriptions and the 1982 valuation; a political oddment file with a German anti-semitic leaflet, 1933, and student protest material from the 1960s and early 70s; and three files about the Florence flood, documenting the losses suffered by the firm, 1966-67.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: . 0$aBooksellers and bookselling--Italy.
. 0$aFloods--Florence (Italy)
. 0$aPublishers and publishing--Italy.
. 0$aSerristori archive.

Olschki Leo Samuel. Five letters to his son Cesare, both personal and with details about his book-buying activities. A copy of his testament dated July 5th., 1939. [1911-21]
Olschki, Leonardo. Part of his correspondence to an from his brother Cesare. [1904-1952]
Olschki, Leonardo. Part of his correspondence to an from his brother Cesare. [1953-1961]
Olschki, Cesare. Letters of condolence on his death. [1971]

Olschki Fiammetta. Her speech on the centenary of the firm Leo S. Olschki. [1886-1986]

Olschki Fiammetta. A singularly one-sided correspondence with the Centro Romantico which is part of the library Gabinetto Vieusseux in Florence. The Centro now owns her collection of 741 European travel books for which she made the cataloque raisonne during the years 1988 to 1990.
Olschki Fiammetta. Correspondence with the Centro Romantico. [1988-1990]

Olschki Fiammetta. Travels in Europe, her presentation speech and a few reviews after the book was published. It must be added that she did not get a cent for her labors and that neither the director of the Centro nor the publisher, Daniele Olschki, took notice of her dispositions regarding the title nor the lay-out of the book which should have been logically disposed in chronological order.
Leo S. Olschki Antiquarian Booksellers. Letters from scholars and customers, preserved for names and contents.
Leo S. Olschki Antiquarian Booksellers. Letters from scholars and customers, preserved for names and contents.
Leo S. Olschki Antiquarian Booksellers. Missions to London to assist buying manuscripts for some of the main Italian libraries [1967-1972]
Leo S. Olschki Antiquarian Booksellers. Missions to London to assist buying manuscripts for some of the main Italian libraries [1967-1972]
Leo S. Olschki Antiquarian Booksellers. Missions to Perugia to assist buying manuscripts for some of the main Italian libraries [1967-1972]

Leo S. Olschki Antiquarian Booksellers. File on the SERRISTORI archive (1452-195?). This very important archive consists of over 800 volumes, boxes and large folders of manuscript material from the XVth century to modern times. With summary descriptions of contents and an official valuation made in 1982.
Florence Flood. File with official correspondence for the Circolo dei Librai Antiquari, Fiammetta Witt being president at the time.
Florence Flood.
Florence Flood. File with writings and photographs documenting the losses suffered by the firm owing to this shattering catastrophe. [1966-67]
Art. Photographs and comments concerning: Bernini. A drawing with an identifying description and one drawing by Rudolf Wittkower.
Art. Photographs and comments concerning a Louis Corinth drawing, [self-portrait on both sides].
Art. Comment concerning a painting. Oil on wood of the Royal George.
Art. A fake autograph of a Tintoretto letter (19th century).
Art. Comments concerning a painting by Lumen Van Portengen.
Barbensi, Gustavo. Italian doctor who introduced the application of statistics to medicine in Italy. Author of pioneering works on medicine and medical history. 1965 to 1973.
Bonifacio, Franco. Italian politician and collector. For a time minister of justice. Corespondent with Olschki-Witt from 1967 to 1986. Part 1.
Bonifacio, Franco. Correspondence Part 2.
Bononi, Loris Jacopo. Author and bibliophile. Correspondence 1969-1972.

Borroni Salvadori, Fabia. Art historian, bibliographer. Published "Il Nuovo Cicognara" in 12 volumes as well as important works and articles on subjects relating to history and art-history. A friend and corespondent from 1976 to 1982, her death.
Buzzanca, Giampaolo. Dealer. Correspondence. 1965 - 1979.
Buzzanca, Giampaolo. Dealer. Correspondence. 1965 - 1979.

Heckscher, William S., Scholar. Correspondence 1964-65.
Heckscher, William S., Scholar. Correspondence 1965-67.

[Hanford, Henderson] An involved correspondence about a Soutman drawing, first attributed to P.P. Rubens. Eight ff. of references accompany two photographs. Apart from letters and post-cards to and from H. Henderson who appears here as 11 an unsuccessful trickster. The folder contains letters from Julius Held, Michael Jaffe, Count Antoin Seilern, Pierre Bouffard from the Conseil Administratif de la Ville de Geneve, a few single writings, and finally a correspondence with Sotheby's who, in the end sold the drawing. All to and from M.M. and F. Witt.

Hofmannsthal, Gerty von. Widow of the poet Hugo von Hofmannsthal (1874-1929). A few letters to Fiammetta Olschki Witt who lived with her in Oxford during the years 1948-1950. The letters are of later date.
Jacobi, Erwin Reuben [1909-1979]. Musicologist and collector. [1968-73]

Mooser, R. Aloys. Musicologist and collector. 1969. His last letter is dated August 3rd and he died on August 24th. at the age of 93. On his importance see in enclosed article "R.- Aloys Mooser et sa bibliotheque musicale". (Musees de Geneve, Avril 1972).

Oakeshott, Sir Walter. Scholar, author. Wrote a celebrated study on the Winchester Bible. High Master of St. Paul's, Head Master of Winchester, Rector of Lincoln, Vice Chancellor of Oxford. Correspondence.1968-69.
Oakeshott, Sir Walter. Scholar, author. Correspondence.1969-70.

Peyrefitte, Roger. French author and collector. Correspondence.1961-64.
Political Oddments. A small, random collection of ephemera
did.physdesc: in various languages, mainly Italian, going from 1933 (German antisemitic leaflet) to 1979. Includes party (any) and student appeals.

did.unittitle: Praz, Mario. Author of many celebrated critical works on English literature. Pioneer in the study of emblems. Correspondence. 1953-80.
Prezzolini, Giuseppe. Author, journalist, politically involved. The correspondence concerns the sale of his archive now housed in Lugano. [1977]
